intro: Oreorchis patens subsp. coreana, commonly known as the Korean twayblade, is a member of the Orchidaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, greenish-white flowers. Native to Korea, it typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and stream sides. The plant has a short rhizome and produces flowers in late spring to early summer. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
